title: Configure authorization for DND
content:
By default, the tenant admin user that has been allocated to the tenant in Suite Administration has the privilege to access the data and menu items for Design and Deploy (DND). If you want additional users such as service designers to access the DND data and menu items, follow the below sections to configure authorization and configure menu visibility.

Configure authorization for additional users:

  • The tenant admin needs to create Groups and Roles - See Create Groups and Create Roles.
  • The tenant admin needs to assign permissions - See the section Configure DND permissions for additional users

    Configure DND permissions for additional users

    To configure authorization for users to access the DND data, follow these steps:

    1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.
    2. Go to Administration > People and select the user you want to give access to.
    3. On the Person page, under Group membership, select Assign to group.
    4. In the Add groups popup, select the group that you want this user to be a part of, for example, DND_ADMINISTRATORS.
    5. Click Save. Now the user has the privilege to access the DND data. 

    Configure Content Store permissions for additional users

    To configure authorization for users to access the Content Store application, follow these steps:

    1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.
    2. Go to Administration > People and select the user you want to give access to.
    3. On the Person page, under Group membership, select Assign to group.
    4. In the Add groups popup, select the group that you want this user to be a part of, for example, CS_ADMINISTRATORS.
    5. Select Save. Now the user has the privilege to access the Content Store application. 

    Configure user role for menu visibility in the agent interface

        An out-of-the-box role, CMP Agent, is available with permissions to modules that are applicable to the Cloud Management mode. We recommend that you assign this new role to the desired agent users or add this role to the desired group. If you don't want to use the out-of-the-box CMP Agent role, make sure that you have selected the Permission to manage Service Design and Deployment and Permission to manage Operations Orchestration for the desired user role.

        Before you configure the menu visibility for DND, make sure that:

        • The suite admin has deployed and enabled the DND and OO capabilities in Suite Administration.
        • You as the tenant admin have enabled the feature in the agent interface (Administration > Application Settings > Enable Service Design and Deployment). 
        • If you want to use Cloud Cost Reporting, you as the tenant admin have enabled the Cloud Cost Reporting feature in the agent interface  (Administration > Application Settings > Enable Cloud Cost Reporting). 
        • In Administration > Application Settings, the experience mode value includes Cloud Management.

        You can give access to Aggregation Providers to a user by following any one of the two methods given below.

        Update the CMP Agent role and assign it to a DND user

        1. Log in to the agent interface as a tenant admin, and navigate to Administration > People > ROLES.
        2. Select CMP Agent from the left pane and view the details.
        3. Go to Record type. Add the Provider record type for the role and allocate Create/View/Update/Delete permissions to the Provider record type.
        4. Go to Administration menu visibility and select Providers from the list.
        5. Save the changes made to the CMP Agent role. 
        6. Assign the CMP Agent role to the group that the DND user belongs to, or assign the CMP Agent role to the DND user directly.
        7. Log in to the agent interface as the DND user. The user now has proper rights to access the Build > Design and Run > Deployment Operations menu items. 

        Assign a custom role and the CMP Agent role to a DND user

        1. Log in to the agent interface as a tenant admin and navigate to Administration > People > ROLES.
        2. Select Add and create a new role. While creating a new role, select SMAX as the Application value from the dropdown list. 
        3. Open the custom role from the left pane, and give the role the following permissions.
          Section Permission
          General Log into the application
          Record type Add the Provider record type for the role and allocate Create/View/Update/Delete permissions to the Provider record type.
          Administration menu visibility Select Providers from the list.
        4. Save the changes made to the custom role.
        5. Assign both the custom role and the CMP Agent role to the group that the DND user belongs to, or assign the two roles to the DND user directly.

        DND groups

        The following are out-of-the-box DND groups.

        DND_ADMINISTRATORS 

        Users in this group are administrators for all operations in DND. It's recommended that you also add the DND administrators to the OO_ADMINISTRATORS group to provide administration capabilities in Orchestration Management.

        DND_RESOURCE_SUPPLY_MANAGER DND RESOURCE_PROVIDER_ADMIN - This permission provides all required permissions for administering resource providers.
        CMP_ACCOUNTS_TENANT_ADMIN - Roles that have this permission will have tenant administrative rights to the CMP Accounts Service

        CMP_INTEGRATION_GATEWAY_USER - Roles that have this permission will have access to the Integration Gateway Service
        DND_UI_RESOURCE_PROVIDER - DND UI Access to Resource Provider

        SERVICE_INSTANCE_ADMIN - This permission provides all required permissions for administering service instances.

        DYNAMIC_PROPERTY_EXECUTE - DND Dynamic Property Access

        Custom DND roles and groups

        You may wish to create custom DND roles and groups to augment the roles and groups provided by the installation process. For example, the out-of-the-box DND_ADMINISTRATOR role and associated DND_ADMINISTRATORS group provide full access to the image aggregation functionality of DND, but you may wish to provide a more granular role and group, specific to image aggregation.

        To do this, you can create a role named DND_IMAGE_AGGREGATION_MANAGER and assign the following permissions to that role: 

        • CMP_ACCOUNTS_TENANT_ADMIN
        • CMP_INTEGRATION_GATEWAY_USER
        • DND_IMAGE_CATALOG_GATEWAY_ADMIN
        • DND_IMAGE_CATALOG_INTEGRATION 

        You can further create a group named DND_IMAGE_AGGREGATION_MANAGERS and associated the DND_IMAGE_AGGREGATION_MANAGER role with the group.  Assigning users to the DND_IMAGE_AGGREGATION_MANAGERS group will grant those users access to the image aggregation functionality of DND without the need to also grant them access to all other product areas of DND.
